Best practices for maintaining client confidentiality in various settings (e.g., schools, clinics, private practice) and across different communication platforms.
Strategies for obtaining and documenting informed consent for data collection, storage, and sharing, in compliance with privacy regulations.
Review of data breach protocols and procedures for responding to unauthorized access or disclosure of client information.
Discussion of the ethical and legal considerations of using technology in play therapy coaching, including teletherapy and online communication.

lessons.title: Informed Consent and Parental Rights
outline: Comprehensive review of the elements of informed consent, including voluntariness, capacity, and information disclosure.
Guidance on obtaining informed consent from parents or legal guardians, addressing their rights and responsibilities in the coaching process.
Strategies for communicating effectively with parents about the goals, methods, and potential risks of play therapy coaching.
Discussion of situations where parental consent may not be required (e.g., emancipated minors, emergency situations) and the legal and ethical considerations involved.
Review of the legal rights of children and adolescents in relation to mental health services and their participation in decision-making.

lessons.title: Mandatory Reporting and Child Protection
outline: Detailed explanation of mandatory reporting laws and requirements for reporting suspected child abuse or neglect.
Guidance on identifying signs and symptoms of child abuse and neglect, including physical, emotional, sexual abuse, and neglect.
Strategies for documenting observations and concerns related to child safety and well-being.
Review of the reporting process, including who to report to, what information to provide, and the potential consequences of failing to report.
Discussion of the legal protections and immunities afforded to mandatory reporters and the importance of acting in good faith.

lessons.title: Liability and Risk Management
outline: Overview of common legal liabilities faced by play therapy coaches, including negligence, malpractice, and breach of contract.
Strategies for minimizing legal risks through adherence to ethical standards, documentation, and professional boundaries.
Discussion of professional liability insurance and its importance in protecting against potential claims.
Review of risk management strategies for specific situations, such as crisis intervention, suicidal ideation, and threats of violence.
Guidance on responding to complaints, lawsuits, and other legal actions, including seeking legal counsel and cooperating with investigations.

lessons.title: Documentation and Record Keeping
outline: Best practices for maintaining accurate, complete, and confidential client records.
Review of essential documentation elements, including intake assessments, treatment plans, progress notes, and termination summaries.
Discussion of record retention policies and procedures, in compliance with legal and ethical requirements.
Strategies for documenting sensitive information, such as disclosures of abuse, suicidal ideation, and substance use.
Guidance on electronic record keeping and data security measures to protect client privacy.

lessons.title: Legal and Ethical Consultation
outline: Importance of seeking legal and ethical consultation when faced with complex or ambiguous situations.
Strategies for identifying qualified legal and ethical consultants with expertise in play therapy and child welfare.
Discussion of the process of consultation, including preparing relevant information, asking clarifying questions, and documenting the consultation.
Review of the benefits of ongoing consultation and supervision for maintaining ethical competence and navigating legal challenges.
Ethical considerations for providing consultation to other professionals and the importance of maintaining confidentiality and professional boundaries.

lessons.title: Introduction to Group Play Therapy and Workshops
outline: Defining Group Play Therapy and differentiating it from individual play therapy.
Exploring the unique benefits of group dynamics in play therapy, such as social skill development and peer support.
Overview of different types of group play therapy workshops (e.g., social skills groups, grief support groups, anger management groups).
Ethical considerations specific to group play therapy, including confidentiality and managing group dynamics.
Applying the 'P' (Presence & Perspective) of the P.L.A.Y.E.D. Framework™ in a group setting: Creating a safe and inclusive environment for all participants.

lessons.title: Planning and Structuring Effective Group Play Therapy Sessions
outline: Determining appropriate group size and composition based on age, developmental level, and presenting issues.
Developing session themes and objectives aligned with the group's needs and goals.
Creating a structured session format that includes warm-up activities, play-based interventions, and cool-down/processing time.
Selecting appropriate play materials and activities that promote engagement and therapeutic outcomes.
Incorporating the 'L' (Listening & Limits) of the P.L.A.Y.E.D. Framework™: Setting clear expectations and boundaries within the group play space.

lessons.title: Facilitating Group Dynamics and Managing Challenging Behaviors
outline: Strategies for fostering positive group interactions and building cohesion among participants.
Techniques for addressing conflict and resolving disagreements within the group.
Identifying and managing common challenging behaviors in group play therapy (e.g., aggression, withdrawal, attention-seeking).
Using play-based interventions to redirect challenging behaviors and promote prosocial skills.
Utilizing the 'A' (Assessment & Attunement) of the P.L.A.Y.E.D. Framework™ to understand the underlying needs driving challenging behaviors in the group setting.

lessons.title: Specific Group Play Therapy Interventions and Activities
outline: Exploring various play therapy techniques suitable for group settings (e.g., cooperative games, role-playing, art activities).
Adapting individual play therapy interventions for group use.
Implementing structured activities that target specific therapeutic goals (e.g., social skills, emotional regulation, problem-solving).
Utilizing storytelling and puppet play to facilitate group discussions and emotional expression.
Incorporating the 'Y' (Yielding & Validation) of the P.L.A.Y.E.D. Framework™: Allowing children to lead the play and validating their feelings and experiences within the group context.

lessons.title: Running Play Therapy Workshops for Specific Populations
outline: Adapting group play therapy approaches for children with specific needs (e.g., autism spectrum disorder, ADHD, anxiety disorders).
Designing workshops tailored to address specific issues (e.g., bullying prevention, grief and loss, trauma recovery).
Modifying activities and interventions to accommodate different developmental levels and learning styles.
Collaborating with other professionals (e.g., teachers, counselors, therapists) to provide comprehensive support.

Integrating the 'E' (Empowerment & Expression) of the P.L.A.Y.E.D. Framework™: Encouraging children to express themselves freely and creatively, fostering self-esteem and emotional regulation in specific workshop settings.

lessons.title: Integrating Caregiver Involvement in Group Programs
outline: Strategies for involving parents or caregivers in group play therapy programs.
Conducting psychoeducation sessions for caregivers on the benefits of play therapy and strategies for supporting their child's progress.
Facilitating parent-child play sessions within the group context to promote attachment and communication.
Providing caregivers with resources and tools to reinforce therapeutic gains at home.
Applying the 'D' (Development & Discussion) of the P.L.A.Y.E.D. Framework™: Facilitating discussion and reflection with caregivers to support the child's development and progress in the group.

lessons.title: Evaluating and Documenting Group Play Therapy Outcomes
outline: Developing methods for assessing the effectiveness of group play therapy interventions.
Using standardized assessment tools to measure changes in children's behavior, emotions, and social skills.
Collecting qualitative data through observation and feedback from participants and caregivers.
Documenting session progress and outcomes in a clear and concise manner.
Using data to inform future program development and improve the quality of group play therapy services.

lessons.title: Advanced Considerations: Ethical Dilemmas and Cultural Sensitivity in Group Settings
outline: Addressing complex ethical dilemmas that may arise in group play therapy (e.g., confidentiality breaches, boundary violations).
Developing strategies for promoting cultural sensitivity and inclusivity within group settings.
Adapting interventions to meet the needs of diverse populations.
Navigating issues related to power dynamics and privilege within the group.
Consulting with supervisors and colleagues to address ethical concerns and ensure culturally competent practice.

outline: Exploring telehealth platforms for remote play therapy coaching sessions.
Implementing client management systems (CMS) to streamline administrative tasks.
Utilizing data analytics to track client progress and outcomes.

Planning for long-term financial sustainability and retirement.

Building relationships with referral sources and community partners.
Measuring the effectiveness of your marketing efforts and making adjustments as needed.

outline: Ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Developing policies and procedures to protect client privacy and confidentiality.
Addressing potential ethical dilemmas that may arise during expansion.
Maintaining appropriate professional liability insurance coverage.
Consulting with legal and ethical experts as needed.

lessons.title: Creating Sustainable Systems and Processes for Long-Term Growth
outline: Documenting standard operating procedures (SOPs) for key tasks.
Implementing quality control measures to ensure consistent service delivery.
Developing a system for ongoing evaluation and improvement.
Creating a culture of innovation and continuous learning.
Establishing clear communication channels within the team.

lessons.title: Leadership and Management Skills for Scaling a Play Therapy Coaching Business
outline: Developing effective leadership skills to inspire and motivate your team.

Managing conflict and resolving disputes constructively.
Creating a vision for the future of your practice or program.
Building a strong network of mentors and advisors to support your growth.
